bug.author: guggio
bug.description:
Describe the bug For my experiment, I don't use a dev set and thus don't need the dev evaluation after a certain amount of training steps. Therefore, I set the eval_every variable to 0 in my experiment-json (as suggested in the description in the json) . Unfortunately, this leads to a ZeroDivisionError as listed below. It seems to me, an additional conditional statement (self.evaluate_every != 0) in line 249 of train.py would resolve this issue. I was able to perform my experiment by setting it to a number, larger than the total training steps, but this is just fighting the symptoms. Thanks guys and keep up the great work! Error message <denchmark-code>/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/farm/train.py in train(self) 247 248 # Perform evaluation --> 249 if self.global_step % self.evaluate_every == 0 and self.global_step != 0: 250 # When using StreamingDataSilo, each evaluation creates a new instance of 251 # dev_data_loader. In cases like training from scratch, this could cause
ZeroDivisionError: integer division or modulo by zero </denchmark-code>
Expected behavior No Error :) To Reproduce Run an experiment with the eval_every variable set to 0 (value or default, doesn't matter). System:
OS: macOS 10.15 GPU/CPU: FARM version: latest master

comments.comment: Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/guggio>@guggio</denchmark-link> thanks for reporting this bug. It looks like we need a simple check. Would you be interested in adding the check and creating a PR since you spotted the problem? I can also gladly take over.
